newsitem.title: UK: IBCA may cut Cable & Wireless ratings.
newsitem.headline: IBCA may cut Cable & Wireless ratings.

text.p: IBCA, the European rating agency, said on Wednesday it placed its A long-term and A1 short-term ratings for Cable and Wireless Plc on ratingwatch for a possible downgrade.

"The rating action follows yesterday's announcement of the agreement between Cable & Wireless (C&W), Bell Canada International Inc (BCI) and NYNEX Corporation to create a new UK telecommunications and entertainment company," IBCA said in a statement.

IBCA said the company, to be called Cable & Wireless Communications, would be able to offer local, national and mobile telephony and data services as well as multi-channel television and Internet services by combining the existing interests of Mercury Communications Ltd, NYNEX Cablecomms Group Plc, Bell Cablemedia Plc and, through a related transaction, Videotron Holdings Plc.

"This move gives C&W a much stronger position in British local telephony and access to the entertainment and multimedia sectors as well as lessening dependence on its Hong Kong operations," IBCA said.

"The rationale behind the venture is to develop greater contiguity of franchises which brings cost savings through reducing central overheads, greater engineering efficiencies and augmented purchasing power when dealing with the programme providers," the rating agency said.

IBCA said the structure of the deal would give C&W a 52.6 percent stake in Cable & Wireless Communications (NYNEX will have 18.5 percent, BCI 14.2 percent and public shareholders 14.7 percent) which would require the consolidation of the cable companies' net debt.

This was approximately 455 million stg at their respective 1995 year ends but capital expenditure over the course of the year was likely to have been substantial and the cable companies did not generate sufficient cash at this stage of their development to fund such expenditure, IBCA said.

"C&W is also purchasing an additional 5.17 percent stake in Mercury from BCI and there will be an outflow to Le Groupe Videotron. C&W has existing annual capital expenditure requirements of 1.0 billion which may lead to short-term financial pressure. It has therefore been placed on RatingWatch Negative pending analysis of the company's likely coverage ratios and the protection offered to investors," IBCA said.
